LoadAndSaveData package¶

Submodules¶

LoadAndSaveData.get_iot_data module¶

Created on 30 September 2016 @author: Parantapa Goswami, Yagmur Gizem Cinar

LoadAndSaveData.get_iot_data.get_data(file_name, line_indices='all', header=True)[source]¶

Read data from InternetOfThings dataset.

Parameters:
  • file_name (string) – .csv filename with raw data
  • line_indices – indices of lines to read from file. Lines are enumerated from 1. If “all”, read the whole file
  • header (bool) – Specifies if the file contains a header row
Returns:

data, metric_ids_dict, host_ids, header_names
Return type:

tuple
LoadAndSaveData.get_iot_data.read_all_lines(file_name, header)[source]¶

Read (all lines) from file in InternetOfThings format.

Parameters:
  • file_name (string) – .csv filename with raw data
  • header (bool) – Specifies if the file contains a header row
Returns:

data - list of pandas.Series; metric_dict - dictionary, maps ts numbers device names; host_ids - dictionary,

maps host names to devices; header_names stores columns names, read from the header row :rtype: tuple

LoadAndSaveData.get_iot_data.read_random_lines(file_name, line_indices, header)[source]¶

Read specific lines from file in InternetOfThings format.

Parameters:
  • file_name (str) – .csv filename with raw data
  • line_indices (list) – indices of lines to read from file. Lines are enumerated from 1
  • header (bool) – Specifies if the file contains a header row
Returns:

data - list of pandas.Series; metric_ids_dict - dictionary, maps ts numbers device names; host_ids - dictionary,

maps host names to devices; header_names stores columns names, read from the header row :rtype: tuple

LoadAndSaveData.load_energy_weather_data module¶

LoadAndSaveData.load_energy_weather_data.load_ts()[source]¶

Loads energy consumption and weather time series

Returns:TsStructures with loaded data and reference names
Return type:list, list
LoadAndSaveData.load_energy_weather_data.load_ts_by_dirname(dirname, folder_name)[source]¶

Load time series of specific type from EnergyWeather dataset

Parameters:
  • dirname (string) – path to directory with input data, ends with “orig”, “missing_vale” or “varying_rates”
  • folder_name –
Returns:

sStructures with loaded data and reference names
Return type:

list, list

LoadAndSaveData.load_time_series module¶

LoadAndSaveData.load_time_series.from_iot_to_struct(ts_list, idx, dataset)[source]¶

Converts data from IoT output to tsStruct. Request is single point for every ts and history is unknown

Parameters:
  • ts_list (list) – stores data in pandas.Series format
  • idx (list) – indices of time series in ts_list correspondent to specific host/dataset
  • dataset (string) – host/dataset name
Returns:

data structure with selected time series
Return type:

TsStruct
LoadAndSaveData.load_time_series.load_all_time_series(datasets=None, load_funcs=None, name_pattern='', load_raw=True)[source]¶

Data loader

Parameters:
  • datasets (list) – contains names datasets to download
  • load_funcs (list) – contains callables for each dataset. Used if load_raw=True
  • name_pattern (string) – expression to look for in loaded file names
  • load_raw (boolean) – If set to True, the raw data is reloaded first
Returns:
Return type:
LoadAndSaveData.load_time_series.load_raw_data(load_funcs)[source]¶

Loads and saves raw data in .pkl format

Parameters:load_funcs (list) – Each function (callable) is load_funcs loads some dataset
Returns:
Return type:None
LoadAndSaveData.load_time_series.save_ts_to_dir(ts, tsname, dirname)[source]¶

Saves time series into specified directory

Parameters:
  • ts (list of TsStruct) – time series
  • tsname (string) – Filename. Data will be saved as .pkl, do not specify any extensions
  • dirname (string) – Directory that stores processed data
Returns:
Return type:

None

LoadAndSaveData.write_data_to_iot_format module¶

LoadAndSaveData.write_data_to_iot_format.ts_to_csv_row(ts, dataset)[source]¶

Converts time series into csv strings. Status is replaced with “nan”s. Device name is replaced with ts.name

Parameters:
  • ts (TsStruct) – input time series
  • dataset (string) – dataset name, replaces host name in IoT format
Returns:

strings to write into file as a csv row
Return type:

list
LoadAndSaveData.write_data_to_iot_format.write_ts(ts_struct=None, file_name='data.csv')[source]¶

Write time series into .csv file in IoT format

Parameters:
  • ts_struct (TsStruct) – data to be written into file
  • file_name (string) – output filename
Returns:
Return type:

None
